description.title: What is XML Formatter?
description.text: XML Formatter is a free online tool designed to help developers format, minify, and validate XML data. It transforms unreadable or minified XML into a structured, easy-to-read format with proper indentation, or compresses it for efficient storage and transmission.

howTo.title: How to Use XML Formatter
steps: Paste your XML code into the input box
Click 'Format XML' to beautify the code with proper indentation
Click 'Minify XML' to remove whitespace and reduce file size
Use the 'Copy' button to copy the result to your clipboard

questions.q: Is my XML data sent to a server?
questions.a: No, all formatting and validation are performed entirely within your browser using JavaScript. Your data never leaves your device.

questions.q: Does it handle large XML files?
questions.a: Yes, it can handle reasonably large XML files efficiently within your browser's memory limits.
It can help identify syntax errors, but it cannot automatically fix broken XML structure. You'll need to correct the errors based on the feedback provided.
